Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: Gail W
Reviews.Content: Where to start? We had an absolutely great stay of 9 days. This was a very convenient location and we used it as home base. We had a lovely room and the breakfasts were a delight with quite an array of foods. I was travelling with my adult son and daughter and we stayed in an immaculate triple room with very comfortable beds,an updated bathroom, and light streaming in the two windows. I communicated with Mehmet Emen, the general manager when booking the reservation and he was very professional and helpful. On most days, Ercan Yazici was available ensuring that everything ran smoothly for guests. He and the staff were friendly and very service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “sarnic premier hotel the place to go”
Reviews.Author: Mia A
Reviews.Content: i was stayed for 5 nights in sarnic premier hotel it was the most beatiful gift i had .let s start from the staff absolutely lovely,helpful and nice so smily ,the room so comfortable and clean,the yummy food ever , and speacialy the location near and close to the most important monuments in istambul so speachless until know ..;sarnic premier hotel is the place to recomended thanks to all sarnic premier hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for first time in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gizmoBuryStEdmunds
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me for my birthday begining of march and went and booked through expedia,who were very helpful.Our transfer,booked through expedia also was very smooth and no trouble,as was our return to airport after our holiday,the hotel is very clean,comfortable,lovely staff and a wonderful breakfast,with a huge choice of cooked food and continential.It was within walking distance of everything you need to see,such as the blue mosque,which is just up the road,to the sophia hagia,opposite,we also got a 2 hour bus tour from the square outside the sophia hagia,for about 8pounds each,which was very good,with a guided tour by headphones,the topkapi palace wasnt far either as was the grand bazaar which was amazing.beware of friendly people hanging around the sights ,you think they are being helpful but really only want you to come and look in their carpet shop! we can recommned the restaurant next door to the hotel,they do turkish evenings,with dancing and the whirling dervish, and the hippodrome down the road opposite the hotel,a small restaurant with a lovely ambience, and friendly staff,also visit the basillica cistern by the side of sophia hagia.a great trip,would recommend istanbul to everyone,as it is so unique.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: southernsally
Reviews.Content: I guess our stay at the Sarnic Premier was made all the better by the fact we were upgraded to the hotel's suite but everything about the Sarnic Premier was good. Location was brilliant - only a 2 min walk from the Blue Mosque and lots of eating options. Reception staff were very helpful and breakfast buffet had lots of choice and was very tasty. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “December 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ana M
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff,excellent facilities and great location.Comfortable and cozy rooms.If ever again in Istambul,weÂ´ll be staying there. Kristina and Carolyn Medcalf

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AsadRuiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, comfortable and enjoyable. Staff was helpful at all times. Location was amazing, few minutes walking from the major historical places of Istanbul. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TaprobaneGirl
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask. Was in Istanbul in Oct 2011 for a girlie weekend and wanted somewhere that was in a safe locale, good value for money and close enough to walk to all the sights. This hotel hit the spot every time. We were a bit daunted when we first pulled up to the hotel as it seemed run down in a cramped neighbourhood with several men milling around aimlessly on the pavement outside. Our first impressions weren't helped when we stepped into the reception area where we were asked to wait for the manager before we could go up to our rooms. 15 mins of waiting later, our fears were put to rest by a very eloquent smartly dressed individual who made us feel very welcome and we were shown to our stunningly decorated incredibly spacious room. Looked completely newly refurbished in a striking white and majorelle blue colour scheme. We were in the shadows of the Blue Mosque, with the patio windows looking straight out onto the domes. The bathroom was a little cramped, but the powerful rain shower more than made up for this. Breakfast was an incredible spread of hot and cold, local and European dishes. It more than set us up for the day. The best bit about this incredible little gem was its incredibly convenient location. The neighbourhood felt very safe, even late at night. We were 5 mins away from all the main attractions, made even more convenient by being able to walk through the Arasta Bazaar to and from the Blue Mosque and all the other attractions. There were lots of other shops and restaurants close to the hotel which we were very happy to get distracted by. All in all a fantastic little gem, which I will be very happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: BrendanArthurRing
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this Hotel. The staff were friendly and very accommodating, even going so far as to have some sandwitches ready for us at 5 in the morning, so we would have something to eat on our flight to Cappadocia. This hotel is in a great location. The Blue Mosque is right around the corner and it takes 3 minutes to walk there. Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Pallace and the Grand Bazaar are just a few of Istanbul's popular locations that are all within walking distance. The rooms are small but comfortable and the complimentary breakfast buffet is tasty, with many hot and cold items to choose from. All in all I would stay here again. It's perfect for a comfortable stay in Istanbul's Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Istanbul Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Stephen P
Reviews.Content: Sarnic Premier Hotel (there is another hotel next to the Sarnic Premier that is just called "Sarnic Hotel." We stayed at the "Sarnic Premier.") made our stay in Istanbul and absolute joy for our family of four. A representative was waiting for us at IST; very easy to get to and from the hotel. It was a bit tight with four adults in a single room, but Sarnic accommodated our wishes that we stay together (<$$$). The room was well appointed and had a great view of the Blue Mosque. The food was very good and the hotel is located in an area that offers many choices for restaurants. The concierge made all of our tour arrangements, including a day trip to Izmir, where an English speaking guide was waiting for us to take us to Ephesus and the surrounding area. The full-day tour of the Bosporus and city are well worth the price. We visited Istanbul during Christmas and it was perfect, if a bit cold. Fewer tourists allowed us time to linger in places that are usually overrun, including the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, and the Topakpi and Dolmabahce Palaces. Our family highly recommends the Sarnic!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: troyohmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sarnic Premier in December with 3 friends for a long girls weekend. The double rooms are clean, very tiny especially the bathroom, walls a bit thin, and windows open to let in some fresh air. Comfort wise, beds were just ok if not a little uncomfortable (mattress) but bedding nice and clean. Lamps next to beds had no lightbulbs...asked to have bulbs put in at front desk and it was never done. Breakfast was exceptional and included in the room rate. There was a variety of breads, pastries, cheeses, meats, olives, hot items including egg, potatoes, and a meat, juices and coffee. Additionally, there is a water station located in the breakfast room where drinking water is available all day. We usually had a drink in the breakfast room before heading out to dinner in the evening. They make a great pomegranate martini with fresh squeezed juice. There are many restaurants around the hotel but the best walkable ones are located just north of the Hippodrome area. It is a very touristy area though. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate and make sure transportation one way is included in your price as well as the breakfast. Also, hiring a local guide for one or two days is definitely a plus and highly educational. I would do the Grand Bazaar on your own and not with a guide...they will take you to shops they do business with frequently which would be alright if they didn't get a commission from these stores and become a bit pushy with the expensive merchandise...just a heads up.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yan J
Reviews.Content: I have been a globe trotter, I live on suitcases. I have been to so many countries that go beyond my calculations. Yet this December I had my first visit to iStanbul. It was a quick decision to visit this city on business. Two days before my flight, I logged on to the internet, this hotel caught my eyes. I noticed it was a 4-star hotel located in the city center. The great bazaar, the great mosques, other scenic spots...are within the walking distance. The hotel is clean, well-lit and cozy. The breakfast is rich, I like its cobra soup...Last but not the least, it is 100% safe. You can sleep like a log every night, needless to worry about bombs or other things, for she is not eye-catching---a beauty in disguise. I feel at home. If I came to iStanbul next time, I will "sleep" with Sarnic.

Reviews.Title: “Sarnic Premier Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jp901
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. All the major sites are within easy walking distance. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They were always willing to help with a smile. They speak very good English so we didn't have any trouble understanding them. We were surprised to find that the restaurant is open for both lunch and dinner and the food is pretty good. My husband was very sick on Sunday night and the chef was off which I didn't know. One of the staff was aware of his illness and offered to cook me some dinner which was quite good. My only negative would be that the rooms are on the small side and the walls are thin. I have not been kept awake due to the thin walls though. The shower is good and the towels are much larger than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to main touristic sites”
Reviews.Author: csp170772
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sultanhamet district and it is really a stone's throw from the main touristic sites you cannot miss. The district has many local restaurants and little shops. The hotel atmosphere is warm and nice and staff is willing to help. Furthermore, they can arrange a pick up service at main airports so that your holiday starts in a complete relaxed and pampered atmosphere from the very moment you step off your flight!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fairwindstraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for visiting the sights in the old town. The rooms were very, very clean and although small, very functional. The shower was especially nice. There is a kettle in the room and tea & turkish delight are supplied. The breakfast room is very homey and the selection was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bariser4
Reviews.Content: My family and I truely enjoyed our stay in Sarnic Premier in istanbul. A very cozy place at a suberp location of istanbul. Dont forget to try the cooking class offered by the head cook of the Hotel. Excellent experience indeed!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD MEMORIES”
Reviews.Author: Georgia C
Reviews.Content: Our experinece in Sarnic Premier Hotel was very nice!The service was excellent and the staff very kind!Its location is sensational and in the restaurant you can have traditional tasty meals!I will definately visit this hotel once more!

Reviews.Title: “A must for visitors of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vernon P
Reviews.Content: As a group of 8 teachers and ex-teachers, we 'city-hop' each year. The visit to Istanbul was significantly enhanced due to our experience at Sarnic. It is ideally placed for all locations, the rooms are very well presented and maintained with a high level of cleanliness. However, the highlight of the hotel is the outstanding friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. All staff are impressive but the manager deserves particular mention for his humour and effectiveness. This hotel is a must for visitors of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Philippa O
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Premier Hotel in Istanbul made our holiday very easy and enjoyable. It's in the best place - easy to walk to all the big attractions yet quiet and pleasant. It's right beside the best small bazaar - so much easier to buy some good quality things than in the ferocious atmosphere of the Gran Bazaar - which is fun but no place to make decisions. They were entirely helpful and knowledgeable, fixing personalised transport from the airport on a delayed flight that arrived at an impossible hour. Walking distance to excellent restaurants and most of the important museums and close to Istanbul's excellent tram service to most other things. Delightful garden and restaurant in which to enjoy the excellent Turkish breafast which is included in the tarif. Roof cafe views of the mosque and the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Gnkv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for4 nights and I hope Iâ€™ll stay again The hotel is in a very good location, nearly to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia (3 minutes by walk). The room was very confortable, no noise and very clean,.The Sarnic Premier Hotel is a small lovely hotel and has a pretty garden. The breakfast was awesomeâ€¦ If the weather is sunny you can have your breakfast at the garden as wellâ€¦ Free wi-fi in our room and also thereâ€™s a notebook on the lobby and you can use it free charge as well when you need. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We got everything we needed in the room in a few minutes. I exactly prefer this hotel to when I go back to Istanbul! Actually I recommend this hotel who are go to Ä°stanbul!!! Thank you Sarnic Premier!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Svetik M
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT!!! This is the true spirit of Istanbul- welcoming and pleasing! No matter if for a business trip or a family holiday, the loveliest and most convenient place to stay :)) The staff is bright and friendly â€“ they know the answers to your questions, and know how to problem-solve and troubleshoot your challenges without hesitation. Excellently furnished rooms. Restaurant that serves international dishes for lunch and dinner. I am happy to recommend Sarnic Premier Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ReikoRing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time here. When I got to the airport our driver was waiting for us. There was no waiting or worrying. He didn't speak very much english but he was so nice. When we got to the hotel we found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The next day we had to leave for the airport to go to Kapadoccia at 4am. They went out of there way and had big wrapped sandwiches ready for us before we left, free of charge. The room was smaller than we expected but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The shower was small to but it had two luxury shower heads. The complimentary breakfast was delicious heathy variey: fresh vegetables, fruit, scrambled eggs, fries, meats and cheeses. They had cereal too. The chai tea and coffee was great aswell. The people at the front desk were so helpful. They gave us a map and directions to all the places we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but had many gripes”
Reviews.Author: SteveSarah8
Reviews.Content: Overall my wife and I had quite a nice stay at the hotel. The location is excellent, the rooms were clean and the staff were friendly (except for one man behind the reception). Also there was unlimited free wifi which was a pleasant surprise and very useful. However - we did have quite a few gripes. 1) The room was much smaller than they make it out to look in the pictures. The bathroom in particular is very small indeed with virtually no space to move around at all, certainly not enough for two people to be in there at once. Also, not much storage in the room - no shelves in the wardrobe, no chest of drawers, very few hangars. This meant we had to leave a lot of stuff out. 2) The safe in the wardrobe was not secured into it at all - so anyone could just pick up the safe and walk out with it. Didn't give me any confidence when going out for the day that all of our worldly possessions could be taken so easily. More of an unsafe than a safe if you ask me. 3) Breakfast every day was absolutely terrible. An array of food that was not appetising in the slightest. Cereal with warm milk, lots of processed meats and some awful cooked choices that weren't even warm and not appropriate for breakfast. 4) The hotel is twinned with the Sarnic - two hotels sharing one reception, one dining area, one set of cleaners etc. The only difference between the two hotels is the room quality at the Sarnic Premier (which isn't that great anway) and the price! 5) The 'window overlooking the blue mosque' was not overlooking it at all - we could just about see the roof of the mosque over some other buildings between the hotel and the mosque. We probably looked at the mosque from our window twice during our stay - not worth paying the premium. 6) Our bed sheets weren't changed once during our four night stay. On the final day (as we were leaving) we found out we were supposed to have put a card on our bed each day requesting the sheets were changed. We realise this is partly our fault for being dopey, but we weren't told this at the beginning, nor was it clear what we were supposed to do. 7) The bed was way too soft, you sink into it each time you get in. So soft in fact that I frequently awoke in the middle of the night having gravitated towards the middle of the bed, as had my wife, so we were on top of each other. And not in a romantic way. 8) The hallways were a little messy - piles of sheets and towels dumped on the ground that we had to step round each time. 9) The main picture that you can see of the front of the hotel (the one on the website and on here in fact) is not a fair reflection of the hotel. It's not the front of the hotel at all, it's the side and not nearly as flash as it looks. You actually enter the hotel via a small inconspicuous door on the street, then to get to your room you have to walk through a corridor, outside, along a passageway, through the restaurant and then to the lifts. Not the nicest way to get to your room each time. The above gripes make it look like we didn't enjoy it at all, and probably make me out to be a right nit-picker. We did in fact have a comfortable stay. I'm not saying we would return to this hotel as we wouldn't, but if location is the most important thing, then you would have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great combination of comfort, style and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Helen I
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Sarnic Premier Hotel this July. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable and have a very fresh and stylish look. The staff were extremely helpful and personable and helped me to plan my stay in Istanbul. The garden where breakfast is served is very peaceful and pretty and an unusual feature in a hotel in Istanbul and the rooftop terracwe has a fantastic view of Istanbul, especially the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. A great place for a drink in the evening! I really recommend this hotel for good value, comfort and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff, charming garden”
Reviews.Author: istar g
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sarnic three times over the last 3 years and NEVER had a bad experience. The fiirst time was with a group of 30 college students I was leading and the staff could not have been more patient and helpful, We were an unusual crowd in a small, boutique hotel and the front desk staff, the kitchen staff, in fact the entire management team went out of their way to attend to our every ridiculous need and request, even carried all 60 of our suitcases in and out of the bus on the airport transfer, and always with a smile. I was so impressed that I booked the hotel again when meeting up with friends in Istanbul the year after, and the year after that. Both times, I was very happy with the rooms and the service. The buffet breakfast always includes a home-cooked delicacy like chocolate cake or flakey layers of dough with feta cheese, along with the usuals. Location could not have been better!! Close to all the best in old Sultanahmet (and the light rail that takes you to the Bosphorus) and you can even see the Blue Mosque from the roof. I went to Sarnic again this year when I was visiting Istanbul, because I wanted to see the new garden. A very charming, little oasis in the middle of busy Sultanahmet. I had a wonderful lunch next to a Roman wall covered in English ivy. Lovely space all around!

Reviews.Title: “George/Rudi, Competa , Spain”
Reviews.Author: George S
Reviews.Content: A well managed hotel, All staff were very helpful, smiling and cheerful, all good signs of a happy and a contented team. a good buffet breakfast was included and was served in a sparkling clean dinning room or could be taken into the charming walled garden or up onto the roof terrace via a very efficient lift, where the view over the Blue Mosque and the Bophorus is lovely. The Sarnic Hotel location is just great for all the historical areas of this ancient city and close to the efficient tram system connecting to the "new" city across the Golden Horn waterway. This hotel and its professional team certainly helped make our week in this wonderful city of Istanbul a very relaxed and a memorable occasion.

Reviews.Title: “The Best, didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: nstein94
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Premier Hotel is a small lovely hotel with a peaceful garden and roof deck (overlooking the Blue Mosque and Sea of Mamara.). Every member of the staff went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I began referring to the hotel as "home". The manager, Mehmet not only went out of his way to make our stay memorable, but ran a three hour cooking class for nine of us. We learned to cook a five course Turkish meal and then were served it on the roof deck with much wine and beer. We stayed for 8 nights and I would happily stay again. Our friends who came to the cooking class have chosen to stay at the hotel for the end of their trip because it was so inviting. Bravo to all the people at the hotel who made our stay in Istanbul outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, tasteful rooms and decor”
Reviews.Author: hapakdc
Reviews.Content: We chose Sarnic Premier given its a newer hotel with completely modern and tasteful design for an otherwise hokey hotel touristy area. Its location was perfect. Set in the center of Sultanahmet our hotel room balcony opened up on a perfect view of the Blue Mosque - which the hotel is literally set behind. The Blue Mosque is a 5 minute walk, Haggia the same. There are tons of little restaurants and bazaar alleys around the way and as 3 girls traveling on our own, we felt safe and in the middle of it all. The service was especially fantastic. My luggage was lost before I even made it to Istanbul, and they tirelessly helped me call baggage services to claim it 3 days later and ensure I got it back intact. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Julian_69_88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia (5 minutes). The room was very confortable, no noise and very clean, with Blue Mosque views. The breakfast had not variety of fruits or hot meals, but it was enough to us. The staff was very helpful, good service. I think this hotel is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Special weekend”
Reviews.Author: dancerdancer
Reviews.Content: I was on my own in Istanbul for the weekend, my first time to Turkey and I had a really special weekend. The location of the hotel was perfect and they looked after me, from before I arrived, arranging my pick up and offering suggestions for my time in Istanbul. The staff were charming and the view from the roof terrace - perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19may
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sarnic Hotel in June (me & my Mom). It was amazing!! The hotel has an excellent location (you can see Blue Mosk from the terrace). Rooms are clean and very well-designed (modern black & white style), staff was very helpful and friendly. We got everything we needed in the room in 3 minutes. They have nice breakfast area and restaurant on the roof. This is really best place to stay!!! Also it was very quite in the night, no noise (my Mom can't sleep if it's noisy). Guys, no doubts - stay in Sarnic Hotel if you are planning to see beautiful Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “I definitely recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GTatiana
Reviews.Content: - Very friendly staff! On our early arrival from the airport, we were welcomed with unexpected coffe and tea at the very enjoyable back garden. After asking us if it was our first time in Istanbul, we were given all the touristic information about the city and recommendations one could ever have. All the staff (reception, breakfast, room maids) were always attentive to guest needs and very helpfull. - Room was charming and well decorated, and with a magnific view from the Blue Mosque! There were turkish sweets in our room one day - a very nice touch! Also, good internet access. - The location was perfect! In the heart of Old Istanbul, walking distance from all main sightseeings (so near Blue Mosque!), but in a quiet and nice street. - A very nice back garden, where we had breakfast every morning. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, brand new hotel, nice location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: sb1099
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children (ages 7 and 3) stayed here for 5 nights in the king suite with a view of the blue mosque. The room had a king size bed (which is really somewhere between a queen and a king by US standards), and a twin bed. There was also a chaise by the window which our 7 yr loved to sleep on. The blue and white decor is elegant and soothing at the same time. The hotel is brand new; we may have been the first occupants of our room. The bathroom was small but tastefully done; it had no bath tub but the handheld shower compensated. The windows could be tilted open for fresh air or shut close. The room was sound proof enough with the windows closed that we did not wake up with the 5 AM prayer call. We were able to control the temperature in the rooms to our liking. The only downside to the rooms was that closet/storage space was limited. Wireless internet was also slow. The hotel is a 10 minute (or less) walk from the blue mosque. There are many restaurants and shops (Arasta Bazaar) within walking distance. We were able to find taxis at the taxi stand a few steps away. We booked a half day Bosphorus and Golden Horn tour from the hotel, it was reasonably good. Service at the hotel was excellent. The hotel gets 5 stars despite some kinks because of the service, mainly Sedet who took care of our every whim. He shopped for snacks and juices for us when we just arrived, never let us carry our toddlerâ€™s stroller down the stairs at the entrance to the hotel, picked up and delivered our laundry â€“ he is just amazing. Now to the kinks: The hotel claimed to have a terrace restaurant when we made our reservation, it did not. It was being constructed. In fact we had to go to their neighboring restaurant to have breakfast which was an annoyance in the rain because we had to be dressed for the â€˜outdoorsâ€™ as soon as we were up. It did not really matter in the overall scheme of things, because our jetlagged kids ended up waking late most days anyway so we ended up missing it. At the end of our stay both restaurants were nearing completion, so we donâ€™t see it affecting future guests. Lastly our airport transfer was a no show when we arrived in Istanbul. Of course the manager arranged for our transfer on our way back for free instead, but we would have rather preferred that the transfer showed up when we arrived in Istanbul after a 10 hour international flight. We attribute these issues to the hotel being new - people meant well and work very hard. One night we walked up to the terrace, and the view of the blue mosque was awesome. I am sure that the restaurant, when it opens, will add to the value of the hotel.
